articles.title: COVID-19 cases, deaths in the Americas triple in 2021 - P.M. News
articles.description: PAHO describes the year 2021 as “undoubtedly worse” for the Americas, where infections, deaths tripled compared to the first year of covid-19
articles.content:
By Cecilia Ologunagba/NAN

articles.title: America’s death penalty divide: why capital punishment is getting better, and worse - The Guardian
articles.description: This year the US saw the fewest executions since 1988, but those states sticking with judicial killings are displaying grotesque aberrations
articles.content:
More than half of the states in the US have either abolished the death penalty or have formal suspensions in place, as the countrys use of the brutal punishment continues to wither on the vine.
